Rakesh wrote:

> Hi All,
> 
> I am sorry, I used "Recursive" in place of "Repetitive".
> Which has changed the whole problem itself.
> 
> Let me try to explain my problem again.
> I want to implement something like this scenario
> 
> public MyClass
> {
>     public static void main(String args[])
>     {
>         while(true)
>         {
>             // execute the test cases.
>         }
>     }
> }
> 
> I have a TestSuite, which is having all my TestCases.
> My setUp() and tearDown() functions make sure that I don't execute
them
> for all the test cases,
> Indeed, these methods run once only, so I have initialization done
only
> once.
> I am quite comfortable with running my TestSuite, which runs all the
> test cases in it.
> Now my requirement is I need to run it continuously, say for more than
> 24 hours or so.
> So I need to run my TestSuite "Repetitively" and not "Recursively".

Either use RepeatedTestCase (part of JUnit) or build the repeated test 
suite by hand.

One key question: if you repeat the test n times, is that n tests or 1 
test? If it's 1 test, then just write the loop in your test.
